metadata.classification_level: TOP SECRET//COMINT//REL TO USA, AUS, CAN, GBR and NZL
metadata.title: NSA Global SIGINT Highlights: French Envoy Plans to Release List of U.S. Firms Who Allegedly Profited from OFF(2004)

overview: This intelligence report details the interception of French Ambassador Jean-David Levitte's communications, revealing his intent to expose U.S. firms allegedly profiting from the UN Oil-for-food program, despite only French companies being named in the Iraq Survey Group report.

methodology.description: Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) collection method was used.

background.context: The NSA intercepted communications from the French Ambassador expressing dissatisfaction with the Iraq Survey Group's report, which named French companies but not U.S. firms, despite alleged connections.

allegations.description: Allegation that French companies acted as subsidiaries of U.S. firms, benefiting from the UN Oil-for-food program.
allegations.findings: Intercepted communications confirm Ambassador's plan to expose these allegations to U.S. Congress and media.

key_findings: Ambassador Levitte criticized the omission of U.S. firms in the report.
He intended to present evidence to U.S. Congress and media.
risks: Potential diplomatic tensions between the U.S. and France.

findings: NSA successfully gathered intelligence that could lead to diplomatic challenges.
